revised_title: Determination of the Number of Beta-Particles Emitted in the Transformation of Radium
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the average number of beta particles emitted by radium B and radium C. They used two methods to measure the number of particles and found that radium B emits slightly more than one beta particle, while radium C emits slightly more than half a beta particle on average. This research helped improve the understanding of radioactive decay and the properties of beta particles.
